prompt:
You are a medical consultation expert.
Your task is to create NEW medical consultation Q&A pairs that follow the same format and style as the examples below.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Generate COMPLETELY NEW scenarios (not copies of examples)
2. Match the format, style, and quality exactly as shown in the examples
3. Provide clear, detailed doctor responses
4. Cover different medical topics if possible

EXAMPLES (study the format carefully):

================================================================================
Example 1:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: my taste buds are blunt and could not feel the taste does this imply recurrence of bell palsy

PATIENT: hello doctor I had bell palsy before few months and it resolved within two months I was treated by a neurologist then but now I feel that my taste buds are blunt and I cannot taste very well within the past day or so I have no other symptoms of bell palsy yet but this is how it started back it was on my left side I am worried that I am getting bell palsy again is it possible to get it so soon again and if I feel it is what shall I do shall I start my steroids and acyclovir again

DOCTOR: hello welcome to icliniq com I can understand your concern try finding any other cause of taste loss like consumption of any drug like metronidazole if you are sure that no other cause explains it then I will suggest to get nav nerve conduction velocity egg electromyography test because it can pick up delay in nerve conduction earlier than the symptoms results are available by the same evening bell palsy prophylaxis is not recommended anywhere however if I imagine myself in your position I would start the medication by the time all these investigations are done you can also get a detailed neurological examination many a time clinical signs can be seen when a patient cannot appreciate symptoms if it proves to be bell then we will have a discussion for further causes of recurrent bell s

STATUS: medium severity

================================================================================
Example 2:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: when I eat sweets I become hyperactive what kind of disease is this

PATIENT: hi doctor whenever I eat sweets I get hyperactive I feel like running and after a few minutes I used to get headache can you help me understand what kind of disease is this do we have a name for it how do I control it how can I treat my headache do I need to go for any special treatment

DOCTOR: hi we are here to help you for further information consult an internal medicine physician online

STATUS: low severity

================================================================================
Example 3:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: will I get benefit from sinus surgery

PATIENT: hi doctor I snore and wake up tired daily sometimes my nose is runny all day I have attached my it report for your reference I just wanted to know if surgery necessary will it benefit me please explain

DOCTOR: hello we are happy to help you your it scan concludes that you have retention cyst inside both maxillary sinuses and the right frontal sinus retention cysts form when fluid collections in the sinuses get covered with a mucus lining these cysts produce nasal symptoms of obstruction or running nose which can cause a blocked nose in the night and thus mouth breathing mouth has lot of soft tissues unlike the nose which vibrate while breathing and produce snoring sound yes you will get benefit from surgery an endoscopic clearance of the pathological sinuses will remove your nasal symptoms and help you breathe through the nose at all times including at night by avoiding mouth breathing and snoring for further information consult an ent otolaryngologist online

STATUS: medium severity

================================================================================
NOW: Generate a NEW unique medical consultation scenario following the EXACT same format above:

DESCRIPTION: [brief medical question]
PATIENT: [detailed patient narrative]
DOCTOR: [clear, detailed medical advice - write naturally, don't worry about formatting]
STATUS: [low severity / medium severity / high severity]

Generate ONLY the new scenario, no meta-commentary.
api_response:
DESCRIPTION: my 3 year old has persistent cough for 2 weeks with wheezing sound

PATIENT: hello doctor my 3 year old daughter has been having persistent cough for about 2 weeks now I can hear a wheezing sound when she breathes especially at night she has no fever and is eating normally but the cough disturbs her sleep we tried steam inhalation and honey but no improvement she had similar episodes twice before in the last year but resolved on its own should I be worried about asthma does she need any specific tests or medications

DOCTOR: hello thank you for consulting I understand your concern about your daughter's persistent cough with wheezing given her age and recurrent episodes this could be suggestive of reactive airway disease or childhood asthma I would recommend consulting a pediatrician for proper evaluation they may suggest spirometry if feasible for her age or a trial of bronchodilators to see if symptoms improve meanwhile continue steam inhalation and ensure good hydration avoid known triggers like dust smoke or strong fragrances if symptoms worsen with breathing difficulty or bluish discoloration seek immediate medical attention for further information consult a pediatric pulmonologist online

STATUS: medium severity
